head.title: Saxonica: XSLT and XQuery Processing: xsl:strip-space

meta.name: title
meta.content: Saxonica: XSLT and XQuery Processing: xsl:strip-space

body.p: The xsl:strip-space element is used at the top level of the stylesheet to define elements in the source document for which white-space nodes are insignificant and should be removed from the tree before processing.

The elements attribute is mandatory, and defines a space-separated list of element names. The value "*" may be used to mean "all elements"; in this case any elements where whitespace is not to be stripped may be indicated by an xsl:preserve-space element.
